_meta.description: Expanded Medical Shorthand Glossary for MediTranslate

hypertension.title: Hypertension (High BP)
hypertension.desc: High blood pressure (usually >130/80). Increases risk of heart attack and stroke.

htn.title: Hypertension (High BP)
htn.desc: High blood pressure. Limits blood flow to organs.

hbp.title: High Blood Pressure
hbp.desc: Force of blood against artery walls is too high.

diabetes.title: Diabetes Mellitus
diabetes.desc: Condition affecting how your body processes blood sugar.

dm.title: Diabetes Mellitus
dm.desc: Chronic disease characterized by high blood sugar.

copd.title: C.O.P.D.
copd.desc: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease. Hard to breathe due to lung damage.

chf.title: Heart Failure (CHF)
chf.desc: Congestive Heart Failure. Heart doesn't pump blood as well as it should.

cad.title: Coronary Artery Disease
cad.desc: Damage in the heart's major blood vessels.

mi.title: Myocardial Infarction
mi.desc: Medical term for a Heart Attack.

cva.title: Stroke (CVA)
cva.desc: Cerebrovascular Accident. Blood flow to brain is stopped.

tia.title: Mini-Stroke (TIA)
tia.desc: Transient Ischemic Attack. Temporary blockage of blood flow to brain.

gerd.title: Acid Reflux (GERD)
gerd.desc: Stomach acid frequently flows back into the tube connecting your mouth and stomach.

uti.title: Urinary Tract Infection
uti.desc: Infection in kidney, bladder, or urethra.

uri.title: Upper Respiratory Infection
uri.desc: Common cold or infection of nose/throat.

dvt.title: Deep Vein Thrombosis
dvt.desc: Blood clot in a deep vein, usually in the legs.

pe.title: Pulmonary Embolism
pe.desc: Blockage in one of the pulmonary arteries in your lungs. Seek help.

esrd.title: End-Stage Renal Disease
esrd.desc: Kidney failure requiring dialysis or transplant.

ibs.title: Irritable Bowel Syndrome
ibs.desc: Intestinal disorder causing pain, gas, diarrhea, and constipation.

osa.title: Sleep Apnea (OSA)
osa.desc: Sleep disorder where breathing repeatedly stops and starts.

afib.title: Atrial Fibrillation
afib.desc: Irregular, often rapid heart rate that causes poor blood flow.

amoxicillin.title: Amoxicillin
amoxicillin.desc: Penicillin antibiotic. Finish the full course.

ibuprofen.title: Ibuprofen
ibuprofen.desc: NSAID pain reliever (Advil/Motrin). Take with food.

lisinopril.title: Lisinopril
lisinopril.desc: ACE inhibitor used for high blood pressure.

albuterol.title: Albuterol Inhaler
albuterol.desc: Bronchodilator that relaxes muscles in the airways.

prednisone.title: Prednisone
prednisone.desc: Corticosteroid. Reduces inflammation and suppresses immune system.

mcg.title: Micrograms
mcg.desc: One-thousandth of a milligram. Very small dose.

tablet.title: Tablet
tablet.desc: Solid pill. Swallow whole unless told otherwise.

gtt.title: Drops (gtt)
gtt.desc: Liquid drops (usually for eyes or ears).

npo.title: Nothing by Mouth
npo.desc: Do not eat or drink anything.

ac.title: Before Meals (ac)
ac.desc: Take on an empty stomach before eating.

pc.title: After Meals (pc)
pc.desc: Take after eating to prevent stomach upset.

bid.title: Twice Daily (b.i.d)
bid.desc: Take two times a day (e.g., 8am and 8pm).

tid.title: Three Times Daily (t.i.d)
tid.desc: Take three times a day (morning, noon, night).

prn.title: As Needed (p.r.n)
prn.desc: Only take when you have symptoms.

bp.title: Blood Pressure
bp.desc: Vital sign measuring force on arteries.

hr.title: Heart Rate (Pulse)
hr.desc: Beats per minute. Normal resting is 60-100.

temp.title: Temperature
temp.desc: Body heat. >100.4 F is a fever.

bmi.title: Body Mass Index
bmi.desc: Measure of body fat based on height and weight.

cbc.title: Complete Blood Count
cbc.desc: Lab test checking red/white cells and platelets.

bmp.title: Basic Metabolic Panel
bmp.desc: Lab test for glucose, calcium, and electrolytes.

lft.title: Liver Function Tests
lft.desc: Blood tests to check liver health.

a1c.title: Hemoglobin A1c
a1c.desc: Average blood sugar over past 3 months.

ua.title: Urinalysis
ua.desc: Urine test to check for infection or kidney issues.

h/o.title: History Of
h/o.desc: Patient has had this condition in the past.

nkda.title: No Known Drug Allergies
nkda.desc: Patient has no known allergies to medicines.

r/o.title: Rule Out
r/o.desc: Doctor is testing to see if you have this.

d/c.title: Discontinue / Discharge
d/c.desc: Stop taking medication OR send home from hospital.

ama.title: Against Medical Advice
ama.desc: Leaving hospital before doctor says it's safe.

dnr.title: Do Not Resuscitate
dnr.desc: Order not to perform CPR if heart stops.
